## 판결문 요약


409 So. 2d 958 (1981)
Carson Eugene SMITH, alias
v.
STATE.
5 Div. 581.
Court of Criminal Appeals of Alabama.
November 24, 1981.
Rehearing Denied December 29, 1981.
Certiorari Denied, February 26, 1982.
*959 John A. Tinney, Roanoke, for appellant.
Charles A. Graddick, Atty. Gen., and Elizabeth Ann Evans, Asst. Atty. Gen., for appellee.
Alabama Supreme Court 81-338.
BOOKOUT, Judge.
Buying, receiving or concealing stolen property; sentence: ten years' imprisonment.
The only issue appellant presents for review is whether the delay of two years and nine months between his arrest and trial was a denial of his constitutional right to a speedy trial. U.S.Const., amend. VI; 1901 Ala.Const., art. I, § 6. The facts governing this issue are set forth in chronological order as follows:
August 2, 1978Appellant and two codefendants were discovered in possession of a Chevrolet pickup truck hauling a flatbed farm trailer to which a tractor was tied.
August 4, 1978Appellant was arrested and charged with buying, receiving or concealing stolen property, to wit, the Chevrolet pickup truck. Appellant was also charged with other offenses arising from the same incident.
August 8, 1978Defendant posted bond.
August 21, 1978Defendant failed to appear at the preliminary hearing because he was incarcerated in Georgia.
September 18, 1978Defendant's preliminary hearing was held and his case was bound over to the grand jury.
